description: Amazon Web Services GovCloud regions designed for U.S. government agencies and contractors with strict regulatory requirements

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides IAM for identity and access management across AWS services
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures IAM policies, roles, and users to control access to resources
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use IAM policies with least privilege, implement MFA, use IAM roles for applications

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides VPC, security groups, and Direct Connect for controlled connectivity
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures VPC, security groups, NACLs, and network connections
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use security groups and NACLs, implement AWS Network Firewall, use Direct Connect for dedicated links

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides CloudTrail for API logging and service-specific logs
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables CloudTrail, configures log retention, and analyzes logs
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable CloudTrail for all regions, configure S3 bucket for log storage, enable log file validation

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS protects platform audit logs with encryption and access controls
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer protects CloudTrail logs with S3 bucket policies and encryption
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable S3 bucket encryption, use S3 Object Lock for immutability, restrict bucket access with IAM

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS maintains secure baseline configurations for platform services
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer establishes configuration baselines for EC2 instances and services
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use AWS Config to track configuration baselines, leverage AWS Service Catalog for approved configurations

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides security configuration capabilities via AWS Config and Security Hub
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures and enforces security settings using AWS Config and Security Hub
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Security Hub, implement Config rules for security settings, use Systems Manager for enforcement

control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer restricts nonessential programs on EC2 instances
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Harden AMIs, use minimal base images, implement application whitelisting

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides MFA capabilities for IAM users and root account
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enforces MFA for all privileged and remote access
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Require MFA for all IAM users, enable MFA for root account, use hardware MFA tokens for high-privilege users

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS uses FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules in GovCloud
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - inherent in AWS GovCloud

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides incident detection via GuardDuty and Security Hub
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer implements incident response procedures and uses AWS tools for detection
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable GuardDuty, configure Security Hub, use EventBridge for automated responses

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS implements network boundary protection for infrastructure
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer implements boundary protection via VPC, security groups, and NACLs
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Segment networks using VPCs and subnets, deploy Network Firewall, use security groups for micro-segmentation

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS enforces TLS for management plane connections
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures TLS for application load balancers and data transfer
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use ALB with TLS listeners, configure TLS 1.2+ policies, use ACM for certificate management

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides encryption capabilities using FIPS 140-2 validated modules
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables encryption for data at rest and in transit
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable EBS encryption, use S3 encryption, enable RDS encryption, use KMS for key management

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides platform-level encryption for data at rest
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables encryption for EBS volumes, S3 buckets, and databases
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable default EBS encryption, use S3 default encryption, enable RDS encryption for new databases

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS patches platform services and infrastructure
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer patches EC2 instances and container images using Systems Manager Patch Manager
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Systems Manager Patch Manager, configure maintenance windows, use automated patching

control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer implements anti-malware on EC2 instances
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Deploy anti-malware agents to EC2 instances, use GuardDuty for threat detection

control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer ensures anti-malware definitions are updated
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Configure automatic definition updates for anti-malware, monitor update status

control_mappings.aws_responsibility: AWS provides CloudWatch for monitoring and GuardDuty for threat detection
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures monitoring, sets alarms, and responds to findings
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Configure CloudWatch alarms, enable GuardDuty, use Security Hub for centralized monitoring

notes: AWS GovCloud provides strong infrastructure security with shared responsibility model. Customer has more responsibility for configuring security features compared to SaaS offerings.
